newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end 2.32 pct up on foreign buying.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end 2.32 pct up on foreign buying.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended 2.13 percent up on Wednesday on foreign buying of select blue chips and dealers said the index could gain another 100 points or so before a general election set for February 3.

"Investor interest was broad-based, but PTCL and Hub Power were the main attraction for foreign buyers as the stocks were at attractive levels," dealer Shakil Anwar said. "The index can rise another 100 points or so in a pre-election rally."
The Karachi 100-share index rose 32.36 to end at 1,429.58 amid 154 gainers and 53 losers. PTCL rose 1.90 rupees to 27.60 and Hub Power 0.75 to 35.75. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192

Faysal Bank rose 1.25 rupees to 23.25, Adamjee Insurance 3.50 to 93, Dewan Salman Fibre 0.50 to 33.15, Hub Power Co 1.25 to 35.70, Pakistan State Oil 7.50 to 282.50 and Sui Southern Gas 1.0 to 26.25. PTCL rose 1.90 to 27.60 and Fauji Fertilizer 2.50 to 72.50.
